lines.text: He who questions training only trains himself at asking questions.
[Mr. Furious tries to balance a hammer on his head]
Why am I doing this, again?
When you can balance a tack hammer on your head, you will head off your foes with a balanced attack.
And why am I wearing the watermelon on my feet?

[looks at the watermelon on Mr. Furious' feet]
I don't remember telling you to do that.
Okay, am I the only one who finds these sayings just a little bit formulaic? "If you want to push something down, you have to pull it up. If you want to go left, you have to go right." It's...
Your temper is very quick, my friend. But until you learn to master your rage...
...your rage will become your master? That's what you were going to say. Right? Right?
Not necessarily.
May the forks be with us.
We've got a blind date with destiny... and it looks like she's ordered the lobster.
We're not your classic heroes. We're the other guys.

[to her father's skull, after avenging his death]
OK, now I'm going back to graduate school. That was the agreement.
When you care what is outside, what is inside cares for you.
[the trio talks about recruiting more heroes for the team]
Well, there's The Sphinx, of course.
The what?
The Sphinx.
I know this guy. Big crime-fighter from down South. Big-league hitter down there.
What's his power?
Well, he's terribly mysterious.

[dismissively]
That's it? That's his power? He's mysterious?
Well, TERRIBLY mysterious.
Plus he can, like, cut guns in half with his mind.
Sorry, but am I to understand you've inserted your father's skull inside of that ball for bowling?
No, the guy at the pro shop did it.
Hey Dad, I'm going to my room with three strange men.
We are number one. All others are number two, or lower.

[talking about Carmine the Bowler]
Seems there was a little controversy there regarding your father's death.
Yes, the police said he fell down an elevator shaft. Onto some bullets.
You know, I've alwas suspected a bit of foul play there.
As have I.
I don't need a compass to know which way the wind shines.
You must lash out with every limb, like the octopus who plays the drums.
You must be like wolf pack, not six-pack.
They must have ripped the "Q" section out of my dictionary, 'cause I don't know the meaning of the word "quit".
If we had a billionaire like Lance Hunt as our benefactor...
That's because Lance Hunt IS Captain Amazing!
Oh, here we go...
Don't start that AGAIN. Lance Hunt wears glasses, Captain Amazing DOESN'T wear glasses.
He takes them off when he transforms...
That doesn't make any sense, he wouldn't be able to see!

[after becoming invisible for a moment and reappearing naked]
I'm invisible. Can you see me?
Yes!
Wow.
Two hands there, son.
[Invisible Boy covers up]
Maybe you should put some shorts on or something, if you want to keep fighting evil today.
Why are you guys always dissing me? It hurts my feelings. I'm a superhero too. I have powers.
Really? Like what?

So glad you asked. Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me. Well, it all started when I was just 13 years of age. One day, while walking with some friends, I accidentally cut the cheese. Well, in my adolescent awkwardness, I blamed it on an old gypsy woman who happened to be passing by. BIG MISTAKE! The gypsy woman placed a curse upon my head. Because I smelled it, she decreed I would forevermore BE HE WHO DEALT IT!
his clothes get so tight he can't even breathe.
Okay. Right now, I'm kinda like a powder keg, and you're the match.
[last lines]
[to the news reporters]

Excuse me, could I say something? I think we would all like this victory to go out to all the other guys, and I'm talking about the people in this city who are super good at their jobs but never get any credit. Like the lady in the DMV - that's a rough job.
To the people that remember jingles from tons of old commercials.
And uh, uh, people that support local music and seek out independent film.
And the guy that drives the snow-plow. And the school nurse, that's a...
Eddie, Eddie, I think they got the point.
What's the name of this group?
The Super Dudes!
No, no, no, not the Super Dudes.
We're not the Super Dudes. We don't have a name yet, but we're definitely not the Super Dudes.
I gotta get home, it's late...
[a photojournalist approaches]
Picture, picture time!
Well, whatever you call them, Champion City will forever owe a debt of gratitude to these mystery men.
Wait! Wait, that's it!... We are the Super Squad.
No, no! Alliteration in these situations is corny... What?
[She opens her bag, where Carmine sits smouldering]
Yes, we're all very aware that you saved the day, and I'm sure we'll be hearing about it for the rest of our lives...
[Mr. Furious, the Blue Raja, and the Shoveller are sneaking across Frankenstein's property to undertake some reconnaissance]
Shh! Wait! Hear that? We must have hit a trip-wire. It could be a proton eviscerator heating up.
It could be a cybernetic atom scrambler. They target moving objects.
It sounds more like a heat-seeking anthrax projection gun to me. Quickly, cover your mouths.
No, let's bolt! Come on!
No! Don't move.
Don't breathe!
Let's bolt!
Don't move!
Don't breathe!
Let's bolt!
Don't move!
[a sprinkler system turns on and the three are soaked]

[disgustedly]
Ohh, it's the sprinkler.

[seeing superhero auditions in her home]
Oh, I don't deserve this!
I know.
A lot of other men I could have married, Eddie - still are!
I understand.
If ONE person vomits in my pool, I'm divorcing you!
That's fair.
Watch it, Spleen, you're going to kill someone with that thing!
Oh, no, no, no. All these weapons are completely non-lethal.
Wow. How wonderfully eccentric while simultaneously being a complete waste of our time. Good day, sir. I say good day.

[as the Blue Raja and the Shoveller walk away]
Well here I thought I was with a couple of real superheroes, the Shoveller and the Blue Raja! But really, it's Lazy Boy and... and... the recliner! Lazy Boy and the Recliner!
All right, I'll take point, you two flank. Let's triangulate.
Equilateral or isosceles?

[after leaving the bar]
The Shoveller is hammered!

This is egg salad. It's loaded with cholesterol, the wife won't even let me touch it. It hardly seems to matter now 'cause, chances are, we're already dead. Amazing is gone, there's no use waiting for the cavalry, because as of this moment, the cavalry is *us*!
I say, what the fork! Let's do it!

[Listing superheroes he has met]
Let me see, who else have I met? There's The Pincer, The Pickler, Princess Headbutt, um... White Flight And The Black Menace - they work together.
[the Mystery Men have accidentally killed Capt. Amazing]
Oh my god. Oh my god, we killed him.
[the Shoveller is standing on the other side of the room]
What do you mean *we*? I was standing right here.

[about to toss her father's skull into the doomsday device]
Dad, this is the way it has to be. The upshot is you won't be killed because you're already dead.
[Mr Furious recommends a publicist for him and his friends]
What are we gonna publicise, Roy? The fact that we get our butts kicked, a lot?
Well, maybe if you didn't smack me in the face with a shovel every time we went out, we'd have a few more victories to brag about.
All right now, I'm sorry about that. I just have a tendency to lose my concentration when I've got a salad fork stuck in my rear end.
Oh, oh I get it, so YOUR shovel in HIS face is MY fault?
You threw a spoon at the guy, Jeff!
Yeah, what was up with that?
I, I, I am embarrassed about that. I thought it was a fork.
You're the master of cutlery. You couldn't throw a knife sometimes when someone's trying to kill me?
No, I can't! You couldn't, uh, use a rake sometimes?
No. I'm the Shoveler.
Well, I'm the Blue Raja. I'm not Stab Man, I'm not Knifey Boy - I'm the Blue Raja.
Yeah, that's another thing...
What?
Well, you could work a little blue into the uniform somewhere. I mean you've got green, you've got this little flowery thing going on, but it's like everything BUT blue.
Well, if we could just step out of our literal minds, just for a moment...

[the Blue Raja's mom walks in on him, in full costume, rummaging through her silverware drawer]
Jeffrey, what are you doing?
Um, I was just, um, uh, um, I'm, uh...
[shifts to British accent]
I'm a superhero, mother.
A superhero?

An effete British superhero, to be precise. I am pilfering your tableware because I hurl it. I hurl it with a deadly accuracy. The Blue Raja is my name. And yes, I know I don't wear much blue and I speak in a British accent, but if you know your history it really does make perfect sense. The point is, your boy's a limey fork-flinger, Mother. Hard to swallow, I know, but there 'tis. What will the bridge club think?
You need more forks?
We struck down evil with the mighty sword of teamwork and the hammer of not bickering.
Well, I'd better get going. I got a city to save.
Jeffrey?
Yeah.
Do the accent.
Oh. Uh, well...
[shifts to British accent]
Well, I'd love to stay and chit-chat, Mother, but I fear I must away with me - our metropolis is in the clutches of madmen!
Jeffrey?
Yeah?
Cheerio.
Mother, I really should get going.
Oh. Oh, okay.
Thanks, Mom.
[He hugs and kisses her before leaving]
I don't find you threatening.
Oh! Well, you're very, uh... you're very, uh... kind.
At all.
Lucille, God gave me a gift. I shovel well. I shovel very well.
Honey, you shovel better than any man I've ever known, but that does not make you a superhero.
[the Shoveller starts to say something, but Lucille cuts him off]
No, listen to me. You're a good husband, and a good father. But that's all. Nothing more.
[she walks off, a small boy hugs the Shoveller's leg]
I believe in you, Daddy!

[calling]
Roland, do NOT encourage your father!
After all, I am a ticking time bomb of fury.

[amused at the Mystery Men]
Really. You're... you're all superheroes.
Well, we fight crime. Call it what you will.
[Monica is trying to eat dinner behind the counter when Mr. Furious approaches to try to strike up a conversation. He notices photographs of motorcycles in the magazine she is reading]
You're into motorcycles.

[uninterested]
No, not really.
Oh. 'Cause I got a motorcycle.

[She nods without looking up]
Yeah, what kind?
It's a Harley...
A Harley!

[He nods, then lurches into honesty]
... compatible. It's a Harley-compatible. Basically the same engineering.
If you're gonna bust into that mansion, you're gonna need more than a station wagon.
At the auto yard, there's this old Herkimer Battle Jitney. Sally's always telling me to junk it!
Wait! You have a Herkimer Battle Jitney? That's the finest nonlethal military vehicle ever made!
Don't mess with the volcano my man, 'cause I will go Pompeii on your... butt.
Looks like tonight the lone wolf rides... alone
[commenting On The Disco Boy's arsenal]
What? Guns? That's your power, you shoot guns?
There's no theme at all here.
Weak.
At best.
[a Disco Boy wields a pipe]
And who are you supposed to be, the Disco Plumber?
[they high-five each other]
See, you've got a chain, I would at least make it a gold chain. That's just off the top of my head.

[to Tony C, referring to his outfit]
What's up, Tiger Lily?
Top of your head, huh.
[Tony C pistol-whips Furious]
[the Disco Boys proceed to beat the hell out of Furious, Blue Raja, and the Shoveller]
Rage... taking over...
Ya, ya, ya. Ve've heard all that before.

[Furious' face is all red]
No, no, no. Rage... *really* taking over...
I knew you couldn't change.
I knew you'd know that.
Oh, I know that. AND I knew you'd know I'd know you knew.
But I didn't. I only knew that you'd know that I knew. Did you know THAT?
Of course.
What kinda crazy man blows up a crazy house?
When are you going to tear down that jeep out there?
Now we went through this yesterday. That "jeep" is actually an armored car of some kind. It was made to withstand bombs, I can't just rip it apart with a crowbar.
I'm a Pantera's box you do not wanna open.
It is "Pandora."
Please don't correct me, it sickens me.
[the Spleen walks to the Bowler making kissing noises and clicks tongue]
There's not enough beer in the world, Spleen, I'm sorry.
See now, this is why mad scientists are generally less desirable than your common or garden variety scientist.
Frak-you-later, Frankenpuss!
[throws Frankenstein into the pyscho-frakulator]
You're baby Bowler!
Is that a problem?
Hello, I'm the guy that gave your daddy the shaft. Ha-ha!
I think, right now, we should focus on the positive. Tonight was good.
Yeah? You think so? Cause I was worried it was, um, I don't know... PATHETIC! "Amazing triumphs at a nursing home"? That's great copy, Vic!
Look, I'm a publicist, not a magician. You want big news, you have to have big fights. A superhero needs a supervillain - and thanks to you, we've got none left.
Then get... the Death Man!
Death Man is dead.
Okay... Father Doom!
Life without parole. Apocalypto's doing fifty years. Armagezzmo's in exile. Baron von Chaos got the chair...
Really?
Casanova Frankenstein is locked up in a nut-house.

Casanova Frankenstein - now there was a supervillain! You know, he just... he's got those eyes, you know? I can't do it, but... and that voice! Such pure evil! The battles we used to have - extraordinary!
"Used to." That's the problem, Captain. "Used to."
I... am the Waffler. With my griddle of justice, I BASH the enemy in the head, or I burn them like so! I also have some truth syrup, which is low in fat.
Mmm, oh, this is a fine, elegant Harvey Wallbanger.
Even when it's sucked by scum like you?
Hey, I was wondering... have you seen my address book?
What did it look like?
Uh, it's denim. Says 'hang loose' on it. Picture of a kitten.
I'm not StabMan, I'm not KnifeyBoy, I'm the Blue Raja.

[referring to the Blue Raja's costume]
Yeah, that's another thing... why are you the Blue Raja? I mean, you've got green, you've got a little flowery thing going on, but it's like everything but blue.
Captain, I'm just going to ask you directly. Do you know billionaire Lance Hunt?

[whispers]
It's me.
[the Shoveller looks surprised, and Capt. Amazing laughs]
Naw, I'm kidding with you, I've always wanted to do that.
You're LATE!
'Morning, Sally. I'm sorry I was late; I was up all night defending the city from evil, but I'm sure you don't care about that.
Work starts at NINE! It's *nine-twenty five*!
...I will fork-give you if you fork-get. Haha... who's next?

It's a psychofrakulator. It creates a cloud of radically-fluctuating free-deviant chaotrons which penetrate the synaptic relays. It's concatenated with a synchronous transport switch that creates a virtual tributary. It's focused onto a biobolic reflector and what happens is that hallucinations become reality and the brain is literally fried from within.
All I'm saying is, when we split the cheque three ways the steak-eater picks the pocket of the salad-man.

[at the tryouts]
PMS Avenger. I only work 4 days a month. Anybody have a problem with that?

[nervously]
No, no problem at all. That's good for us. Thank you.
[while driving a huge armored car straight at the front door of Casanova Frankenstein's home]
What do you think? Should we knock, or just let ourselves in?

[after Casanova Frankenstein blows up a building]
Ohh! Mama pajama!

[strapped to a chair]
Listen, I really think we need to talk about your plans here.
Tomorrow night, I'm going to kill you.
Right, that's the part that really doesn't work for me...
When the clock strikes twelve... cuckoo, cuckoo... you will be dead. And my city will be given a new state of mind.
Where's Captain Amazing?
There's been a bit of a cock-up, actually...
Raja murdered him!
[an argument starts]
Guys, I think we have a bigger fish to fry right now!
What's your name?
D-do you mean my secret identity? 'Cause I couldn't...
No, I just mean your name.
My name. Ummm... wow. Okay... It's... Phoenix... Phoenix Dark... Dirk... Phoenix... Dark Dirk. I was christened Dirk Steel and then I changed it to Phoenix...
Forget about it. It's okay.
It's Roy! That's, that's my name. My... my real name is Roy.
Just. Be. Roy. Okay?
Really? I'm not so sure about that. Your first night of freedom, and you blow up the asylum. Interesting choice. I knew you couldn't change.
I knew you'd know that.
Oh, I know that. And I knew you'd know I'd know you knew.
But I didn't. I only knew that you'd know that I knew. Did you know that?
...Of course.

[On the couch watching TV News of the action]
Did that frakulator work or what? What's the deal there?
[an attack on the Mystery Men by the Disco Boys is thwarted by the Sphinx]
Kill ya later, Super Losers!
A fish-fork is no match for my machine!
I have created a beautiful machine that is going to encourage our fellow citizens to share my vision of the future! Can you dig it?
To learn my teachings, I must first teach you how to learn.
[the team are working on the Herkimer Battle Jitney to prepare it for battle]
It's a process which results in an accelerated flow of electrons that creates such a powerful magnetic force.
So this is, basically, like a huge electromagnet.
Well, actually, it's an electro-nuclear-magnet. It's the next inevitable phase.
There's another chicken. Crazy chicken world.
[the Spleen is shot in the rear]
I CAN'T FEEL MY ASS. I CAN'T FEEL MY ASS.
Do your powers still work?
My powers?
Yeah.
Weapons check.
[Invisible Boy pulls Spleen's fingers. Spleen lets loose a wind of gas, wiping out an entire gang]
It'll do.
Hiya fellas. Word on the street is you're lookin' for superheroes.

Listen, I just wanted to say, I had a great time tonight, and you were really nice to me, and I would love to ask you out some time. But if I don't call you, I just want you to know it's because I'm dead.
Come on, somebody do something, we need him.
Okay. Okay, you're a very furious man, you understand that?
No.

You're not well-liked. You're uh, you're abrasive and off- putting. You try and say pithy things, but your wit is a hindrance and therefore nothing is provocative. Just mixed metaphors. Now, doesn't that make you angry? Does it infuriate you?
No.
Well, it should. Aren't you angry? Come on, man!
Your penmanship is atrocious!
You dress in the manner of a male prostitute!
We're an elite cadr-cadrey...
Cadre.
You're in.
So what do you say? Do we all gather together, and go kick some Casanova butt? Or do I eat this sandwich?
That could work. I'm a loose cannon. I'm unpredictable. I stormed off, why can't I storm back?
Or, you could just say you're sorry.
Do you think there's a really angry way I can say I'm sorry?
Stick vith me, Tony, and you vill dance again.
Disco is NOT dead!
And what do you call this?
Careful, careful, that's a Blame Thrower!
A Blame Thrower? Oops.
[He accidentally activates it]
Oh, I'm sorry!
[Suddenly the team breaks out into screaming cross-talk as they blame each other for trivia. 'I'm sorry if I smell all the time,' etc. Heller comes to their help and powers the Thrower down]
I'm sorry.
I'm sorry.
[Spleen leans over for a hug, but Bowler waves him away with an admonitory finger]
No, no. No. No no no. No.
Doctor, you *are* a genius.
That's what the card says.
You guys never learn, do you?
Apparently we don't, ass.
My pants feel like they're shrinking too.
[first lines]

[offering an old lady candy at the Senior dance]
Would you like something sweet?

[impressed]
Oh!

[pleading his case before a committee]
Blessed... disciples of Hippocrates. My heart is torn in two. It aches with guilt from my abominable crimes, yet it is filled with love for this... sanctuary, this place of healing, and it sings with Beethoven's immortal "Ode To Joy" where all men... become... brothers!
Everyone heard me say reset button.
Waffle Man! The Waffler! Gold and crispy! Bad guys are history!
I'm a wannabe. I AM a wannabe - a TRUE wannabe, in the worst sense of... You guys are gonna have to go fight this battle without me.
You start doubting your super-powers, man, you are SHAFTED!
If I had any super-powers to doubt, I w... I guess I'd be in trouble, but I don't. What do I do? I don't. I don't. I go... What do I... I go 'R-r-r-r-r-r'!
What? What are you talking about? You lifted a bus once!
Yes, precisely! That story's legend'ry!
Yeah... It was really more of a...
[waves hand sideways]
... a push, really, than a lift.
That still takes INCREDIBLE super-human strength.
Indeed, it does! To push an entire bus out of the way.
Well, actually, the driver kinda had his foot on the accelerator... JUST in the beginning; just to get it going. Then it actually was me. But he kinda...
Oh, shit.
Oh looky here, a multi frequency radio detonator. You should be more careful when discarding incriminating evidence.
Oh, no, no, no this is quite an amusing little gizmo. It's really quite cool.
Yeah? W-What is it?
[Puff Of Smoke Goes Off In Captain Amazing's Face]

[sniffs]
Yuck.
It's a cholorform-deploying portable enticement snare.
[Captain Amazing Nods In Confusion and both foes stare at each other in silence momentarily]

[sniffs]
Ah, Dang!
[passes out]
I just want to be there when the team rescues Amazing.
Well, you could go back.
Actually, I can't. I just left this morning.
Who would want to rent a chicken?
Ah, the old Disco Room. Just as I left it.
You been locked up for twenty years, Casanova. A lot of things have changed since then.
It must have been hard for you, Tony, the way times and styles have changed... hearing the people say that disco is dead...
Disco is not dead! Disco is LIFE!
Yes, Tony! That is the passion I remember! Stick with me, Tony, and you will dance again... when I rule this town.
